alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 29 at 10:12PM EST until December 29 at 10:30PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN WALKER AND CENTRAL CHATTOOGA COUNTIES... At 1012 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mill Creek to Lake Marvin to near Subligna to near Tidings, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Summerville, Trion, Lyerly, Subligna, Suttles Mill, Villanow, Berryton, Tidings and James H. Floyd State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for northwestern Georgia. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
